intro: Wulfenia gymnocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which includes many plants with showy blue or purple flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in loose inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Wulfenia gymnocarpa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
